etymologies: late 19th century (denoting a sudden rap or tap): imitative; the noun sense ‘unexpected deviation’ dates from the 1970s

definitions: an unexpected, minor, and typically temporary deviation from a general trend

examples.text: an upward blip in house prices

definitions: a short high-pitched sound made by an electronic device

examples.text: computer games can drive you crazy with their blips and bleeps

definitions: a flashing point of light on a radar screen representing an object, typically accompanied by a high-pitched sound

examples.text: air traffic controllers watching the blips on their radars

definitions: (of an electronic device) make a short high-pitched sound or succession of sounds

examples.text: big boxes of esoteric electronics hummed and blipped

definitions: open (the throttle of a motor vehicle) momentarily

examples.text: he straddled the bike and blipped the throttle
